definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: Keep legs straight and move thighs back.
sentences.chinese: 保持双腿伸直，大腿向后方移动。

sentences.english: Our closest relatives straightened their backs and began walking upright on two legs.
sentences.chinese: 人类的祖先伸直了后肢开始直立行走。

sentences.english: When fracture of the wounded lower limbs is secured, limbs wants curved move to show bend ancon unbend to bind.
sentences.chinese: 伤员下肢骨折固定时，肢体要弯着呈屈肘状伸直捆绑。

sentences.english: Lift arms out to side up to shoulder level and then to ears and lower.
sentences.chinese: 首先伸直两臂与肩部平行，然后举起到头顶再放下。

sentences.english: I unclenched my hands and looked at my fingers, white and bent.
sentences.chinese: 我靠在椅背上，松开双手，看到手指煞白且无法伸直。

sentences.english: Yesterday, as a warm-up exercise before class so I can stretch out the legs.
sentences.chinese: 昨天上课之前的热身运动使我今天的腿都不能伸直。

sentences.english: Wrap a strap around sole of the foot and hold with straight arms.
sentences.chinese: 将瑜伽带缠绕在脚掌上，双臂伸直保持。

sentences.english: They raised their hands up straight, so that the teacher could see them.
sentences.chinese: 他们把手举起来伸直，好让老师看见。

sentences.english: Straighter (more extended) outside leg creates a much stronger, biomechanically sound position that helps to withstand huge forces produced in modern turns.
sentences.chinese: 伸直的外侧腿可以在过弯时承受更大的力量。

sentences.english: I have one inch on her in reach.
sentences.chinese: 我两臂伸直的宽度比她长一英寸。

sentences.english: Open your hand and hold your fingers out straight as you see me doing, and then pull.
sentences.chinese: 跟着我做，张开你的手，伸直手指，然后用力往外拉。

sentences.english: He stretched the three thick fingers of both hands and flexed the opposable thumbs.
sentences.chinese: 两只手都把三个指头伸直，弯曲拇指。

sentences.english: The dog uncoiled to its full length.
sentences.chinese: 狗把蜷曲的身体完全伸直。

sentences.english: I unclenched my hands and looked at my fingers, white and bent.
sentences.chinese: 在椅背上，松开双手，看到手指煞白且无法伸直。

sentences.english: I sat against the back of the chair and stretched my arms , I saw my fingers were so pallid and not unbent .
sentences.chinese: 我靠在椅背上，松开双手，看到手指煞白且无法伸直。

sentences.english: The criminal would be attached to a cart wheel and his arms and legs stretched out along the spokes.
sentences.chinese: 犯人被绑在车轮上，手脚顺着轮辐伸直。

definition: to draw together/to place side by side (e.g. one's fingers, two halves of a torn sheet of paper etc)
to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
